comments:
We have a cross-platform RCP app.  It works fine when run inside of the Eclipse workspace, and also works correctly when deployed on OS X 10.4.  But on 10.5, the use of the SWT_AWT bridge causes the following error (below).  The reference to Info.plist I presume to be OurApplication.app/Contents/Info.plist - but StartOnFirstThread is not mentioned in their, nor in OurApplication.app/Contents/MacOS/OurApplication.ini.

We are using 3.3 - it appears that I am using build M20071023-1652 of the Eclipse Platform (from the About/Configuration window).


!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2007-12-09 15:31:59.044
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable (org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: Not implemented [need SWT compatibility pack from Apple] (java.lang.InternalError: Can't start the AWT because Java was started on the first thread.  Make sure StartOnFirstThread is not specified in your application's Info.plist or on the command line))

This is another instance of Bug #199020. The 11/1 integration build (I20071101) has a fix for this.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 199020 ***
